timeline.message:
t push :Merge branch 'master' of github.com:MarcusSorealheis/lucene-solr

* 'master' of github.com:MarcusSorealheis/lucene-solr:
  Fix typo in `cloud-scripts` path

Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/master'

* upstream/master:
  SOLR-14237: Fix HDFS nightly test failure
  LUCENE-9278: concatenate paths for sourcepath using path separator rather than whitespace (which causes invalid option to be passed to javadoc).
  LUCENE-9333: Add gradle task to compile changes.txt to a html (#1468)
  update CHANGES for #807
  Fix tests to survive nightly runs with many documents
  SOLR-14173: Don't use JQuery-Slim as it breaks the sidebar sub-menu system.
  SOLR-14237: A new panel with security info in admin UI's dashboard
  SOLR-14237: A new panel with security info in admin UI's dashboard
  LUCENE-7788: fail precommit on unparameterised log messages and examine for wasted work/objects
  SOLR-14173: Change left nav item highlighting to fix menu jumpiness when hovering/selecting
  LUCENE-9349: TermInSetQuery should use consumeMatchingTerms in visit() (#1465)
  LUCENE-9089: update FST usage example
create a revised PR against master

timeline.bodyText: nit: did you mean to move these imports around?
timeline.author: madrob

replies.bodyText: Yes. I did that because the precommit failed before locally.
replies.author: MarcusSorealheis

timeline.bodyText: Would this make sense to do before the close shield methods?
timeline.author: madrob

replies.bodyText: Not in its current state because response object won't exist, but I could refactor if you have a good reason for that. Or, if I think of one. Gonna peep those methods again now.
replies.author: MarcusSorealheis

replies.bodyText: So, I got pulled away by some work. I'll update. I think it makes sense to drop the response before the close shield if possible.
replies.author: MarcusSorealheis

replies.bodyText: Handling the raw response works better. Looking at the snippet on this page originally I didn't have the full context. Good suggestion. Thanks 👍
replies.author: MarcusSorealheis

timeline.message: add back in the SOLR OPT
fixing docs so that people do not try to add -D java option.
remove the directives for how to start the app with java properties explicitly.
